content.question:
A model of crossing over during gamete formation is shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Model of crossing over during meiosis

Based on Figure 1, which of the following questions could best be addressed?

choices.label: Does synapsis of homologous chromosomes in the parent cell contribute to an increase in genetic diversity in the daughter cells?
Do sister chromatids separate and form diploid daughter cells?
Do chromatids from nonhomologous chromosomes rearrange to produce identical daughter cells?
Does synapsis of nonhomologous chromosomes produce daughter cells that are identical to the parent cell?

content.answer: Does synapsis of homologous chromosomes in the parent cell contribute to an increase in genetic diversity in the daughter cells?

skill.text: 3.A: Identify or pose a testable question based on an observation, data, or a model.
